intro: Artemisia turanica, commonly known as Turanian wormwood, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in steppe and semi-desert regions. Artemisia turanica is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
